intro: Angraecopsis globularis, commonly known as the Cape fovea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spherical shape and striking white flowers. The plant produces showy, tubular blooms that are typically visited by hawkmoths, which are its primary pollinators. Angraecopsis globularis thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
